I've added a bunch of stuff to the statistics page of my image enlargement 
experiment.

http://www.hanlonsrazor.com:81/neat/iex/status.cgi

I may end up changing the topology/fitness visualization, in part because of 
the size of the HTML it generates and in part because I can't scale up the 
population size.  And it's not necessarily the easiest thing in the world to 
read.

Also included is a line on the status of each of the client machines 
participating in the experiment.  Colin, if you update to the latest version 
of the client, your machine will show up there, too.  <hint, hint>  ;)

Take a look.  Let me know if you have any suggestions for improvement.  
Other than the obvious, like a champion topology visualization, a sample 
enlargement using the champion network, and a more scientific evaluation of 
how close the network is in its enlargement (signal to noise ratio and all 
that stuff).

If it takes a while to load, it may be because my upstream bandwidth is kind 
of burdened at the moment.  Which is kind of a good thing...

-- John
